<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Select the proper unsigned integer type from a bit size.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Figure out which byte we&#39;re at in big endian mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92" lineLink="#a05750a81b996121bf5bd6f7bfe968027"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Size&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a05750a81b996121bf5bd6f7bfe968027">getBytePosition</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BitPos) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> % 16) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(BitPos / 8 + ((BitPos &amp; 0b1111) &lt; 8 ? 1 : -1));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!(BitPos &amp; 0b1111) &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Not aligned to word boundary?&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BitPos / 8;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We need special handlings for relocatable &amp; pc-relative operands that are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// larger than a word.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A M68k instruction is aligned by word (16 bits). That means, 32-bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (&amp; 64-bit) immediate values are separated into hi &amp; lo words and placed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// at lower &amp; higher addresses, respectively. For immediate values that can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be easily expressed in TG, we explicitly rotate the word ordering like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#96;&#96;&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (ascend (slice &quot;$imm&quot;, 31, 16), (slice &quot;$imm&quot;, 15, 0))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#96;&#96;&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For operands that call into encoder functions, we need to use the &#96;swapWord&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function to assure the correct word ordering on LE host. Note that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// M68kMCCodeEmitter does massage &#95;byte&#95; ordering of the final encoded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction but it assumes everything aligns on word boundaries. So things</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// will go wrong if we don&#39;t take care of the &#95;word&#95; ordering here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Size&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-m68kmccodeemitter-cpp-/m68kmccodeemitter/#a642ca54e0f1605190dcf5a216d2b10b6"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> M68kMCCodeEmitter::encodeRelocImm(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OpIdx,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">value&#95;t = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/select-uint-t/#aeb4a10aa02b864dfa1579d244a055f7c">select&#95;uint&#95;t&lt;Size&gt;::type</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Relocatable address</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Fixups.push&#95;back(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup/#abdf37854fa6eb68017b96486df443a32">MCFixup::create</a>(InsertByte, Expr,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Size&gt;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Special handlings for sizes smaller than a word.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> &lt; 16) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> LabelOffset = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (InsertPos &lt; 16)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the patch point is at the first word, PC is pointing at the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// next word.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">        LabelOffset = InsertByte - 2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (InsertByte % 2)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise the PC is pointing at the first byte of this word.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// So we need to consider the offset between PC and the fixup byte.</span></CodeLine>
